qas.question: Why were port cities targeted by the Luftwaffe?

answers.text: to try to disrupt trade and sea communications

qas.question: How many times was Swansea bombed heavily?
What was primarily damaged in the attacks?
What cities had large sections of them destroyed?

context: Not all of the Luftwaffe's effort was made against inland cities. Port cities were also attacked <a0_0>to try to disrupt trade and sea communications<a0_0/>. In January Swansea was bombed <a1_0>four times<a1_0/>, very heavily. On 17 January around 100 bombers dropped a high concentration of incendiaries, some 32,000 in all. The main damage was inflicted on the <a2_0>commercial and domestic areas<a2_0/>. Four days later 230 tons was dropped including 60,000 incendiaries. In <a3_0>Portsmouth Southsea and Gosport<a3_0/> waves of 150 bombers destroyed vast swaths of the city with 40,000 incendiaries. Warehouses, rail lines and houses were destroyed and damaged, but <a4_0>the docks<a4_0/> were largely untouched.
